question_text: The rock in the image below has both small and large crystals. This texture is called porphyritic. A likely explanation for the formation of this rock is:

answers.text: The magma cooled rapidly, preserving voids left by gas bubbles. ->
answers.match_pair: The magma cooled rapidly, preserving voids left by gas bubbles. ->

answers.text: The magma cooled slowly, forming only large crystals. ->
answers.match_pair: The magma cooled slowly, forming only large crystals. ->

answers.text: The magma cooled slowly at first, forming large crystals, and then quickly, forming small crystals from the remaining magma. ->
answers.match_pair: The magma cooled slowly at first, forming large crystals, and then quickly, forming small crystals from the remaining magma. ->

answers.text: The magma cooled so rapidly that it produced a solid with no crystalline structure. ->
answers.match_pair: The magma cooled so rapidly that it produced a solid with no crystalline structure. ->
